title: Thunderbird 52.0beta Beta

notes.note: Optionally remove corresponding data files when removing an account from Thunderbird
Calendar: Event can now be created and edited in a tab
Calendar: Processing of received invitation counter proposals
Chat: Liking and favoriting in Twitter

**IMPORTANT:** The way images are included in a compose window has changed. Images are now included as [data URIs][1] and not as references to parts of other messages or operating system files. This allows better interoperability with office packages such as MS Office or LibreOffice. Images linked from locations on the internet will **no longer** be downloaded and attached to the message automatically. This can be changed for each image individually via the Image Properties dialog or globally by setting the preference mail.compose.attach_http_images.

[1]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_URI_scheme
On Linux PulseAudio is now required to play sound
Messages in IMAP folders read on external device are now filtered by default

Chat: Removed Yahoo! Messenger support (since [Yahoo removed support][1])


  [1]: https://web.archive.org/web/20160730080614/https://help.yahoo.com/kb/yahoo-messenger-for-web/SLN26860.html
Crash when viewing certain IMAP messages and various crashes on Mac
Message preview pane non-functional after IMAP folder was renamed or moved
Editing in paragraph format: Pressing Shift+Enter sometimes doesn't move the cursor to the next line
Paste as quotation doesn't always work
Long lines in plain text replies not properly wrapped
Undesired white-space before signature in paragraph mode
Links with escaped non-ASCII (international) characters can't be clicked
Calendar: Events specified in timezone "local time" generate alerts in UTC time

text: **These release notes apply to Thunderbird version 52 beta 4 released Feb 28th, 2017.**
system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems
 - Windows XP SP3
 - Windows Server 2003 SP1
 - Windows Vista
 - Windows 7
 - Windows 8
 - Windows 10

*Please note that while the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows Vista and Windows 7 can be used to run Thunderbird, only 32-bit builds of Thunderbird are supported at this time.*

**Note that Thunderbird 52 is the last release to support Windows XP, Windows Server 2003 and Windows Vista.**
  
### Windows Recommended Hardware
   - Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
   - 1GB RAM
   - 200 MB hard drive space

---

## Mac
  
### Operating Systems
  
- Mac OS X 10.9
- Mac OS X 10.10
- Mac OS X 10.11
- Mac OS X 10.12
  
###  Recommended Hardware
  
 -  Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
 -  512 MB RAM
 -  200 MB hard drive space

---
  
## GNU/Linux
### Software Requirements
  
  *Please note that Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*
  
### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Thunderbird will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - GTK+ 3.4 or higher
    - GLib 2.22 or higher
    - Pango 1.14 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    - libstdc++ 4.6.1 or higher
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - GNOME 2.16 or higher
